artist: Designer: Gloria Caranica; Manufacturer: Creative Playthings
creditline: Gift of funds from The Gynecologic Society of America
description: curved bottom and top sections; bumpers at ends of rocking part and back of seat; stick with red ball at top at front; light varnish overall
inscription:
Inscription

on back of seat, burned into wood: [CREATIVE PLAYTHINGS/ PRINCETON, N.J.]
text: This is not your typical rocking horse. Its minimalist design allowed American children to rethink the horse-and-rider scenario and instead become a World War I fighter pilot or an astronaut flying to the moon. Creative Playthings still makes educational, simple, and abstracted modern toys for children, primarily out of wood, just as they did during the 1950s and 1960s.
title: Hobby horse
